exception.name: ErrorNoDataAvailable
exception.description: This exception is thrown if the SE API export functions cannot find any data matching the provided selection or filter criteria. The functions exportLogMessages or exportFilteredTransactionLogs attempt to export stored data (log messages, transaction records, or other logged information) based on the caller's filtering or selection parameters, but no data in the Secure Element's storage matches those selection criteria. ErrorNoDataAvailable indicates that the export query returned an empty result set - the requested data simply does not exist or has been purged from the device.

javadoc.summary: This class defines the exception ErrorNoDataAvailable that is thrown if no data has been found for the provided selection in the context of the export of stored data.
javadoc.description: This exception is thrown when export functions attempt to retrieve and export stored data based on selection criteria but find that no data matches the specified criteria. Functions such as exportLogMessages and exportFilteredTransactionLogs accept filtering parameters (e.g., date range, event type, client ID, transaction ID) to specify which stored data should be exported. ErrorNoDataAvailable is raised when the Secure Element searches its storage using these criteria and finds zero matching records. This is an expected condition when no data matches the filter, not an error condition - it indicates the export operation cannot proceed because there is no matching data to export. Recovery requires adjusting the selection criteria (expanding date ranges, removing filters, etc.) to find matching data, or confirming that the expected data has not been logged or has been deleted.

specification.section: 3.3.2 Data Export Operations - exportLogMessages and exportFilteredTransactionLogs
specification.requirement: The functions exportLogMessages and exportFilteredTransactionLogs SHALL search the Secure Element's storage for data matching the provided selection or filter criteria and export matching data. If the Secure Element searches the storage based on the provided selection criteria and finds no matching data (i.e., the result set is empty), the functions SHALL raise the exception ErrorNoDataAvailable. This exception indicates that no data matches the selection criteria - it is an expected condition, not a device error.
specification.applicability: Data export operations - exportLogMessages and exportFilteredTransactionLogs functions only, when filter criteria return no matches

condition.scenario: Filter criteria outside available data range
condition.description: The selection criteria (date range, time window, event type) does not match any stored data
condition.trigger: The application calls exportLogMessages with a date range (e.g., January 1-10, 2020) but the Secure Element only contains log entries from 2025. The export function searches for matching records in the specified date range, finds none, and raises ErrorNoDataAvailable.

condition.description: The Secure Element's data storage contains no records at all or all records have been deleted
condition.trigger: The device was recently initialized or all stored data has been deleted via purge operations. An export function attempts to export data but finds no records matching any criteria. ErrorNoDataAvailable is raised.

condition.scenario: Event type filter matches no logged events
condition.description: The filter specifies a particular event type that has never occurred or does not exist in the stored logs
condition.trigger: The application calls exportLogMessages with a filter specifying event type "EventTypeX" but this event type has never been logged. The export function searches the logs for this event type and finds no matching entries. ErrorNoDataAvailable is raised.

condition.scenario: Client ID filter matches no transactions
condition.description: The filter specifies a client ID that has no associated transaction records
condition.trigger: The application calls exportFilteredTransactionLogs with a filter for client ID "UnknownClient" that does not exist in the transaction logs. The export function searches for transactions by this client and finds none. ErrorNoDataAvailable is raised.

condition.scenario: Combined filter criteria produce empty result set
condition.description: Multiple filter conditions together produce an empty result (while each individual filter might match some data)
condition.trigger: The application calls exportFilteredTransactionLogs with complex filter criteria combining date range AND client ID AND transaction state. While data exists for each filter individually, the combination of all filters matches no records. ErrorNoDataAvailable is raised.

executionSequence.step: User/application calls exportLogMessages or exportFilteredTransactionLogs function with selection/filter parameters
Function validates input parameters including filter criteria, date ranges, event types, client IDs, etc.
Function checks authorization and device state for data export operations
Function initiates communication with Secure Element and prepares export query
Function transmits export/search command with filter criteria to Secure Element
Secure Element searches its data storage for records matching the filter criteria
If matching data is found → proceed to step 7
If NO matching data is found (empty result set) → ErrorNoDataAvailable raised, function exits
Function receives matching data from Secure Element
Function formats and packages data for export
Function closes communication channel with Secure Element
Function returns exported data to caller

recovery.step: Verify search parameters match data that exists
Check if data exists using appropriate query functions
Adjust search criteria to match available data
Ensure sufficient data has been created before querying

postconditionality.state: No data is exported or returned to the caller. The export operation produces no output because no matching data exists to export.
The device's data storage remains completely unchanged by the failed export attempt. Storage contents and all data remain in their pre-call state.
The device's overall state is unmodified by the exception. The export operation is read-only and does not modify device state.
All data in the device's storage remains intact and unaffected. The absence of matching data does not compromise data that exists outside the filter criteria.
The caller can retry the export operation with different filter criteria to potentially find matching data.
The failed export operation does not trigger cascading failures or secondary exceptions.

notes.note: Indication: No data is available for the requested operation - data not found
Topics: Data Retrieval, Data Availability, Search Operations, Information Retrieval

scenario.name: Scenario 1: Audit Log Export with Date Range Specification
scenario.description: An audit system attempts to export transaction logs for a specific date range (e.g., "December 1-10, 2025"). When exportFilteredTransactionLogs raises ErrorNoDataAvailable, it indicates no transactions occurred on the device during that date range. The system responds by expanding the date range or checking if transactions actually occurred during the specified period.
scenario.errorContext: Date range filter criteria match no data

scenario.name: Scenario 2: Event Type Filtering with Selective Data Discovery
scenario.description: A monitoring application attempts to export only specific event types (e.g., "PinEntry" events). When ErrorNoDataAvailable is raised, it indicates either that no such events have been logged or that all such events have been deleted. The application adapts by trying broader event type filters or querying available event types first.
scenario.errorContext: Event type filter produces empty result set

scenario.name: Scenario 3: Transaction Log Export with Complex Filtering
scenario.description: An enterprise system exports transaction logs with complex filter criteria (date range AND client ID AND transaction state). When exportFilteredTransactionLogs raises ErrorNoDataAvailable, it indicates that while data may exist for individual filter criteria, the combination of all filters matches no records. The system responds by progressively loosening filters to identify which criteria eliminate all matching data.
scenario.errorContext: Combined filter criteria eliminate all matching data

scenario.name: Scenario 4: Device Status Verification After Initialization or Purge
scenario.description: After device initialization or data purge operations, an application attempts to export existing data. When ErrorNoDataAvailable is raised, it confirms that the device storage is empty (as expected after purge or new initialization). The application can then proceed with validation or configuration knowing the device state.
scenario.errorContext: Empty storage confirmed - expected condition after purge or initialization

implementationContext.note: Raised by export and query functions when no data matches criteria
Search operation returns empty result set
No matching data exists for specified parameters
Query execution completes without finding matching records
